questions.question: Which microscope technique provides the highest resolution for internal cellular structures?
Which microscope is best for viewing live, unstained bacteria?
Which stain is used in Gram staining to fix the primary stain to the bacterial cell wall?
Which of the following statements is true about Gram-negative bacteria?
options: They have a thick peptidoglycan layer
They contain lipopolysaccharides (LPS) in their outer membrane
They appear purple after Gram staining
questions.answer: They contain lipopolysaccharides (LPS) in their outer membrane

questions.question: What is the correct order of Gram staining steps?
Which bacterial structure is responsible for attachment to surfaces and biofilm formation?
Which component is found only in Gram-negative bacteria?
What bacterial structure allows some bacteria to survive extreme conditions by forming a dormant state?
Which bacterial shape is described as comma-shaped?
What phase of bacterial growth is characterized by rapid cell division?
Which virus classification includes single-stranded RNA viruses that must be transcribed into mRNA before translation?
Which of the following correctly describes the lysogenic cycle of a bacteriophage?
options: The virus immediately replicates and lyses the host cell
The viral genome integrates into the host chromosome and can remain dormant
The virus infects only prokaryotic cells
The viral capsid remains outside the host cell
questions.answer: The viral genome integrates into the host chromosome and can remain dormant

questions.question: Which process involves bacterial cells taking up free DNA from their environment?
Which of the following statements about retroviruses is true?
options: They use reverse transcriptase to convert RNA into DNA
They do not integrate into the host genome
They are classified as Group I in the Baltimore system
questions.answer: They use reverse transcriptase to convert RNA into DNA
